title: Fullbeauty Brands Said to Boost Discounts on Apax Buyout Loans
text:
Fullbeauty Brands LP, an apparel retailer for plus-sized people, is offering one of the biggest discounts this year to complete its $1.2 billion loan deal financing its buyout by Apax Partners, according to three people with knowledge of the deal.
A $345 million second-lien portion is being marketed for as low as 87 cents on the dollar, while an $820 million first-lien loan may be sold around 93 cents, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the financing is private.
The retailer has been struggling to attract investors after proposing to sell the larger piece of the financing for as high as 99 cents on the dollar.
JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc., the banks arranging the buyout loans, initially asked investors to commit to the deal by Oct. 2. Offering loans at a discount boosts investor yields and can also eat into underwriting fees and create losses for banks.
A spokeswoman for New York-based Fullbeauty didnâ€™t immediately comment. Representatives for JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs declined to comment.
